conversation.text:
Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend two movies from the list: 
1. The Informers (1994) directed by Daniel Minahan): 
This movie is about two young men who come running out of a dark alley, leaving behind another young man with his neck stabbed. The moment Danny received the message about the murder of Itzik, his only son, his life would never again be the same. Ten years of legal proceedings and new disclosures made during that time have slowly crumbled his faith in gaining justice. Along with the pain of his loss, he realizes that only he can find the truth of what happened that night. His journey in search of the truth reveals his complex identity for the first time: a spy who worked for the security services, an Arab who converted and became a practicing Jew, a man who felt pride, respect and sympathy for a country that has absurdly and horrifyingly betrayed him. 
2. Starship Troopers (1971) directed by Robert Wise): 
This movie is about top scientists who work feverishly in a secret state-of-the-art laboratory to discover what killed the citizens of a small town and how the deadly contagion can be stopped.

Based on the user's preference cues, I recommend the following two movies:

1) TRON: Legacy (2010)
This movie follows the story of a son who goes searching for his father and ends up inside the digital world that his father designed.
The main character, Sam, is played by actor Olivia Wilde. The character of Sam's father is portrayed by actor James Frain. Other notable actors in this movie include Eva Green as the villainous queen, Elizabeth Shue as the wife of the villainous queen, and Jeff Bridges as the leader of the digital world that Sam's father designed.
Overall, TRON: Legacy (2010) is a visually stunning science fiction film that explores themes such as identity, power, and technology. The movie features an impressive cast, including actors Olivia Wilde, James Frain, Eva Green, Elizabeth Shue, Jeff Bridges, and many others.

2) The Best Years of Our Lives (1946)
This movie follows the story of three World War II veterans who return home to the American midwest to discover that they and their families have been irreparably changed.
The main character, Themistocles, is played by actor Myrna Loy. The character of Themistocles' son, Xerxes, is portrayed by actor Peter Mensah. Other notable actors in this movie include actors Elizabeth Shue as the wife of Xerxes, and Jeff Bridges as the leader of the Greek army that fought against the Persian army that was led by Xerxes.
Overall, The Best Years of Our Lives (1946) is a well-made drama film that explores themes such as war, leadership, and family. The movie features an impressive cast, including actors Myrna Loy, Peter Mensah, Elizabeth Shue, Jeff Bridges, and many others.

Please note that the above two movie recommendations are based on the user's preference cues.
